casebody.data:
McCallum et al. v. Grant, Sheriff. (Supreme Court, General Term, First Department. June 6, 1890.) Appeal from special term, New York county. - Action by James McCallum and another against Hugh J. Grant, sheriff of the city and county of New York, to recover damages for the wrongful sale and conversion of plaintiffs’ goods, under execution against a third party. Plaintiffs appeal from an or- . der substituting defendant’s indemnitors as parties defendant in his stead.

Argued before Van Brunt, P. J., and Brady and Daniels, JJ.

J. H. V. Arnold, for appellants. W. F. Severance, for respondent. Per Curiam.

For the reasons stated in the case of Hero Fruit-Jar Co. v. Grant, ante, 28, (decided herewith,) the order should be reversed, with $10 costs and disbursements.
